intro: Elatostema dactylocephalum, commonly known as the thread-leaf elatostema, is a small, herbaceous plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Elatostemaceae and is characterized by its slender, often hairy stems and small, opposite leaves. The leaves are typically elongated and may have a slightly wavy or serrated edge. It produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences, often borne on short pedicels. This plant thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories or along stream banks.
